definitions.definition: a short passage from a book, piece of music, etc. that gives you an idea of what the whole thing is like

examples.text: The following extract is taken from her new novel.
He read out a brief extract from his book.
The extract is taken from a long essay.
The disc also includes an extract from one of his earlier operas.

definitions.definition: a substance that has been obtained from something else using a particular process

examples.text: face cream containing natural plant extracts

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin extract- ‘drawn out’, from the verb extrahere, from ex- ‘out’ + trahere ‘draw’.
